alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 27 at 2:40PM AKST until January 28 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley, Kuskokwim Delta and Bristol Bay. * WHEN...Until 11 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An extremely cold Arctic airmass will continue to linger across Southwest Alaska through at least the weekend. The Lower Kuskokwim Valley, Kuskokwim Delta, and Bristol Bay have observed frigid wind chills at or below -40, with the Lower Kuskokwim Valley even seeing values below -50. As winds lightly diminish through the end of the weekend, the Arctic airmass will stay in place, prolonging very cold wind chills. Temperatures will gradually rebound early to midweek next week.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
